meanings.definition: Characterized by change or variation in circumstances.
meanings.sent1: Life in a vicissitudinous world can be unpredictable.
meanings.sent2: The weather in our region is quite vicissitudinous.
meanings.sent3: The vicissitudinous nature of the stock market keeps investors on their toes.
meanings.sent4: Her mood swings were as vicissitudinous as the changing seasons.
meanings.sent5: The vicissitudinous path of the river carved through the landscape over time.

meanings.definition: Full of ups and downs or unexpected changes.
meanings.sent1: Their relationship was vicissitudinous, with constant highs and lows.
meanings.sent2: The vicissitudinous journey of the protagonist kept readers engaged.
meanings.sent3: The vicissitudinous rollercoaster ride left everyone exhilarated.
meanings.sent4: The vicissitudinous plot twists in the movie kept viewers guessing.
meanings.sent5: The vicissitudinous waves of the ocean crashed against the shore relentlessly.

meanings.definition: Marked by alternating or fluctuating conditions.
meanings.sent1: The vicissitudinous nature of the economy affects businesses.
meanings.sent2: Living in a vicissitudinous climate requires adaptability.
meanings.sent3: The vicissitudinous schedule at work kept everyone on their toes.
meanings.sent4: The vicissitudinous melody of the song captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: The vicissitudinous colors of the sunset painted the sky in hues of orange and pink.
